takeaways: AI is fundamentally changing product development bottlenecks - with 70%+ of code AI-written, the constraint has shifted from engineering capacity to decision-making, alignment, and merge infrastructure. The traditional PM→Engineer→Ship flow is breaking down.

Product value in AI comes from the intersection of product and research - the highest leverage work happens when product teams embed with model training, not just building UX on top of finished models. Ship things only you can uniquely build.

Founder-type engineers matter more than headcount in the AI era - one or two strong technical leads with an idea can move faster than large teams. The ability to compose the right prompts and architect AI-augmented systems is now a specialized, high-value skill.

Don't optimize for Web 2.0 engagement metrics with AI products - time spent, session length, and DAU miss the point. Instead, focus on whether people are unlocking creativity and getting work done they couldn't before. You know it when you see it.

Differentiation beats imitation in crowded AI markets - rather than chasing ChatGPT's consumer adoption, lean into your unique strengths. For Anthropic, that's builders, makers, and hackers who create at the edge of model capabilities.
